verbose_text: To investigate how prenatal immune challenges impact on inhibitory circuits, we used genetically engineered mice to label PV interneurons (PVcre/+; R26tom/+) in two experimental paradigms : (1) MIA triggered by a lipopolysaccharide (LPS) injection at embryonic day (E) 13.5, which mimics a bacterial infection; and (2) early injections of anti-CSF-1R antibodies, which target macrophage precursors in the yolk-sac and lead to a severe depletion of microglia from E7 to E18.5, followed by a repopulation completed by postnatal day (P) 7.
